articles.description: Latest news after a thrilling end to the Women's Nations League group stage, and Luton v Arsenal in the Premier League.
articles.title: Women's Nations League and Premier League reaction

articles.description: In 1951, a celebratory trophy parade is said to have crossed paths with a funeral procession. Whether true or not, their meeting hangs over Mayo's Gaelic football team.
articles.title: Cursed? The story of the 72-year-old hex that haunts Mayo

articles.description: Arsenal are "showing spirit and a courage" to never give up as another late winner sends them five points clear at the top of the Premier League.
articles.title: 'Great teams find a way' - Arsenal showing 'spirit' in title fight

articles.description: Beth Mead says England are "devastated to miss out by such small margins" after being denied a place in the Women's Nations League finals.
articles.title: 'It really hurts' - England 'devastated' at exit

articles.description: Bangladesh batter Mushfiqur Rahim becomes only the second Test batter in history to be dismissed for obstructing the field.
articles.title: Mushfiqur given out for obstructing field

articles.description: LeBron James scores 31 points as the Los Angeles Lakers beat the Phoenix Suns 106-103 in a thriller to reach the semi-finals of the NBA's inaugural In-Season Tournament.
articles.title: James stars as Lakers beat Suns to reach semis

articles.description: F1 Academy head Susie Wolff rejects allegations of a conflict of interest involving her and husband, Mercedes boss Toto Wolff, in the "strongest possible terms".
articles.title: Susie Wolff rejects conflict of interest allegations

articles.description: Newcastle and England goalkeeper Nick Pope requires shoulder surgery and faces four months out, manager Eddie Howe confirms.
articles.title: Newcastle's Pope facing four months out with injury

articles.description: Dominik Szoboszlai is becoming a fan favourite for Liverpool and Hungary - BBC Sport charts the rise of the talented midfielder.
articles.title: 'In the realm of Puskas' - the rise of Liverpool's Hungarian hero

articles.description: Former Australian Open champion Caroline Wozniacki will play in her second Grand Slam since coming out of retirement in August.
articles.title: Wozniacki gets Australian Open wildcard
